definition: main artery (blood vessel)/fig. main highway/arterial road
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
arteries and veins/vein (on a leaf, insect wing etc)

sentences.english: The viaducts are arteries for urban traffic in Shanghai so they are of fundamental importance.
sentences.chinese: 上海高架道路是城市交通的大动脉，其地位十分重要。

sentences.english: Objective To evaluate the diagnosis for and treatment of severe Takayasu′s arteritis .
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨重症头臂型大动脉炎的诊断和治疗方案。

sentences.english: Objective To study the value of Color Doppler sonographic on aortoarteritis.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究多发性大动脉炎的彩色多普勒超声诊断价值。

sentences.english: Gwadar lies right on China’s vital oil artery.
sentences.chinese: 瓜达尔正好位于中国重要的石油大动脉上。

sentences.english: Takayasu's arteritis is a common clinical disease in Norh of China.
sentences.chinese: 大动脉炎是我国北方比较常见的一种临床疾病。

sentences.english: The impact travelling up through thebody can also burst the aorta and heart chambers.
sentences.chinese: 落地时的冲力通过身体破坏大动脉和心房。

sentences.english: These vessels are the two main arteries.
sentences.chinese: 这些血管是两个大动脉。

sentences.english: River Han basin performed an important function of linking up the northwest and middle south for a long time in history.
sentences.chinese: 历史上汉水流域长期是沟通西北与中南的交通大动脉。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the ocular manifestations of the patients with primary arteritis of the aorta and its main branches.
sentences.chinese: 目的对多发性大动脉炎患者的眼部表现进行探讨。

sentences.english: We're gonna transect the great arteries at the sino-tubular ridge.
sentences.chinese: 我们要在窦管脊上横切大动脉。

sentences.english: Objective To explore the clinical features of Takayasu arteritis involving coronary arteries.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨多发性大动脉炎累及冠状动脉的临床特点。

definition: lit. warp string in weaving/fig. vertical or north-south lines/to pass through/to cross lengthwise/to pierce (esp. north-south or top-to-bottom)
Eurasian land bridge (rail line linking China and Europe)
